tournament.name: Friday 4th Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: This deck aims to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast powerful spells for free. The key strategy is to play big threats like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight while keeping the opponent's threats in check with Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes a companion, Keruga, the Macrosage, for additional card draw. With a mix of removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and board wipes like Deafening Clarion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through card advantage and powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through the use of Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. It uses powerful cards like Shark Typhoon, Sphinx of Foresight, and Cavalier of Flame to dominate the battlefield. With Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way providing card advantage and disruption, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. Keruga, the Macrosage acts as a companion, granting additional card draw. Overall, the deck leans heavily on Fires of Invention to cast threats and answers while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. It also includes Fae of Wishes to tutor for specific answers or win conditions from the sideboard. The deck aims to generate card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, while creating threats with Shark Typhoon and planeswalkers like Sarkhan the Masterless and Narset of the Ancient Way. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion for extra value and a long game plan.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing for control over the game. It includes a mix of powerful creatures, removal spells, and card draw to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The companion Keruga, the Macrosage provides additional card advantage to help sustain the control strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently utilizing its resources and powerful spells.

This Sultai Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Leafkin Druid to cheat out powerful creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects. The deck also utilizes cards like Yarok, the Desecrated and Thassa, Deep-Dwelling to double up on these triggers for extra value. With the help of strong threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Agent of Treachery, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption while maintaining a strong presence on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a large board presence and deal damage to the opponent. Using cards like Footfall Crater and Zenith Flare, the deck aims to take advantage of the cycling mechanic to draw cards and deal damage efficiently. With a mix of creatures like Flourishing Fox and Valiant Rescuer, along with combat tricks like Go for Blood and Startling Development, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its aggressive strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion of key cards.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to play powerful spells for free, allowing for strong control over the game. The deck includes a mix of removal, card draw, and powerful creatures to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Keruga as a companion provides additional card advantage. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently casting spells using Fires of Invention while controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. It also includes powerful finishers like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to close out the game. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion allows for card advantage, while the rest of the deck is built around maintaining a strong board presence and controlling the opponent's actions. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient spell usage and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and board wipes while drawing cards and generating value through planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset. It aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and applying pressure with Shark Typhoon. Kaheera provides an additional threat and synergizes well with the deck's focus on creatures. The mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and ensures access to all three colors in order to play the various control cards and ultimatums effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilizing sacrifice effects to gain advantage on the board. By combining cards like Claim the Firstborn, Witch's Oven, and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the deck aims to control the battlefield while dealing damage to the opponent. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Serrated Scorpion and Cauldron Familiar, along with powerful finishers like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Dreadhorde Butcher, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and dealing consistent damage to the opponent. With cards like Claim the Firstborn and Witch's Oven, you can steal your opponent's creatures and then sacrifice them to trigger effects like Mayhem Devil and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Fiend Artisan offers flexibility in searching for key creatures, while Priest of Forgotten Gods provides additional sacrifice outlets. By utilizing these synergies and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures, this deck aims to quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on using control spells and powerful creatures to manipulate the board and opponent's resources. It includes cards that disrupt the opponent's hand, ramp up mana, and provide value through card draw and creature play. The key strategy is to control the game through targeted removal and powerful threats, eventually overwhelming the opponent with a combination of big creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to constantly apply pressure while maintaining control of the game through a mix of powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to establish dominance through powerful late-game threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, while also being able to burn out opponents with Expansion / Explosion. The key strategy is to survive the early game and take over the game in the mid to late stages with powerful, game-ending spells and threats.

Deck focuses on aggressive playstyle utilizing sacrifice synergies with Cauldron Familiar, Witch's Oven, and Claim the Firstborn to generate value and disrupt opponent's board. Utilizes the graveyard with Lurrus of the Dream-Den to continuously bring back threats and maintain pressure. Includes efficient creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Robber of the Rich to chip away at opponent's life total. The deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of early aggression and late-game recursion.
